column3: What are the constraints?

column6: All mobile platforms, back-end services, Gateways, CI systems, .....

column3: What is the availability of the team members?
What has been the most wasteful activity so far?
If you had one week for somebody in the team to learn something, who and what would that be?

If we could have done things differently, what would have made the client twice as happy?

Have we challenged the brand guidelines? Do we need to?

column6: Think also about bonus schemes, personal ambition etc.

column3: Is there anything unknown about the release process?
column6: Test release build process, walk through acceptance and deployment/store release steps.

column6: Who decides, how to avoid undue peer pressure, any extra compensation?

column6: If there are people who joined after the project started.

column3: What is the most significant change in the constraints since the beginning?
column6: Budget, scope, schedule

column3: How happy are we with the backlog? How can we make it better?

What is the biggest thing we haven't told the client.
Based on the current burn-rate how long will the budget still last

If your team is not all sitting at the same location, how often do you co-locate or rotate team members?

Is the amount of technical debt we have created acceptable?
What 3 things would you like to change?

Is the client happier than at the start of the project?
What has been the biggest surprise in the project so far?
What is the difference between the on-boarding of original team members vs those who joined later?
Compared to the beginning, what has changed in the client's business case?
Why should we continue with the project
Are we currently ahead or behind our expectations from the beginning of the project.
column6: Think about budget, scope and schedule.
